ArrayOfLogs.description: Logs as Array of JSON objects

CurrentStep.description: The name of the current step above
CurrentStep.title: Current Step

Description.description: Put here some step description or actual logs

FileName.description: Put here full path and name of the file for import/export
FileName.title: File Name

NextStep.description: The name of the next step below
NextStep.title: Next Step

ArrayOfLogs.title: Logs

BusinessEventId.description: Business Event Id from Azure Service Bus

ContentData.description: Base64 content from Azure Service Bus

CustomErrorMessage.description: Error message that will help to quickly identify what is failed. FTP, FSC, Service Bus, or just put here some text
CustomErrorMessage.title: Custom Error Message

DataPackageURL.description: URL address of the Azure Blob Storage with file and SAS
DataPackageURL.title: DataPackage URL

EnqueuedTimeUtc.description: Date Time stamp from Azure Service Bus

LogicAppExecutionId.description: Logic App Execution Id, like workflow()['run']['name']
LogicAppExecutionId.title: Logic App Execution Id

LogicAppRunId.description: Logic App Run Id, like workflow()['run']['id']
LogicAppRunId.title: Logic App Run Id

LogsType.description: Please use only LogicAppMain or LogicAppConnector
LogsType.title: Type of Logs

MessageId.description: Message Id from Azure Service Bus
MessageId.title: Message Id

Status.description: Use Warning to send an email alert, but in FSC execution status will be OK

Compose_HTML_Email.inputs:
Hi,

Logic app @{triggerBody()['LogicAppName']} has state @{variables('Integration Status')} with status @{triggerBody()['Status']}.


Please find some details below.

Data Package URL: @{triggerBody()?['DataPackageURL']}
DMF Execution Id: @{triggerBody()?['DMFExecutionId']}
Azure Service Bus Message Id: @{triggerBody()['MessageId']}
Azure Service Bus Enqueued time: @{triggerBody()['EnqueuedTimeUtc']}

FSC Business Event Id: @{triggerBody()['BusinessEventId']}
FSC Environment URL: @{body('Parse_JSON_from_ContentData')?['D365EnvironmentURL']}
Data Management Integration Id: @{body('Parse_JSON_from_ContentData')?['DataManagementIntegrationId']}
Data Management Integration Unque Id (Transaction Id): @{body('Parse_JSON_from_ContentData')?['DataManagementIntegrationUniqueId']}
Data Management Direction: @{body('Parse_JSON_from_ContentData')?['DataMigrationDirection']}
DMF Definition Group: @{body('Parse_JSON_from_ContentData')?['DefinitionGroupName']}
Environment Name: @{body('Parse_JSON_from_ContentData')?['EnvironmentName']}
External System: @{body('Parse_JSON_from_ContentData')?['ExternalSystem']} (@{body('Parse_JSON_from_ContentData')?['ExternalSystemDescription']})
FSC Legal Entity: @{body('Parse_JSON_from_ContentData')?['LegalEntity']}

Logic App Name: @{triggerBody()['LogicAppName']}
Logic App Execution ID: @{triggerBody()['LogicAppExecutionId']}
Logic App Execution URL: @{outputs('Compose_Logic_App_URL')}

Custom Error Message: @{triggerBody()?['CustomErrorMessage']}


Logs

@{body('Create_HTML_table_from_Logs')}


It is recommended to open the Logic App URL (@{outputs('Compose_Logic_App_URL')}) and find more details there. However, sometimes URL is not generated well; in this case, please open Azure Portal (https://portal.azure.com/) manually, and open Logic App (@{triggerBody()['LogicAppName']}), and search the following ID @{triggerBody()['LogicAppExecutionId']} in the execution history.

inputs.body: Logs will be submitted in the background
